docs.title: Change of Condition / Provider Notification Policy
docs.heading: Documentation essentials
docs.url_or_location: Binder: Nursing Admin → Policies → Change of Condition
docs.text: Document objective assessment findings, interventions performed, resident response, provider notification, orders received, and family/EC notification when applicable. Compare findings to baseline and note any change.

docs.title: Infection Prevention Policy
docs.heading: Specimen & labs
docs.text: Collect specimens per order and protocol, label correctly, and document collection time and resident tolerance. Ensure documentation is timely and objective.

docs.title: Falls: Post-Fall Assessment & Monitoring
docs.heading: Immediate post-fall assessment
docs.text: Assess for injury, pain, ROM, neuro status, head strike, bleeding/bruising, and compare to baseline. Obtain vital signs. Ensure documentation is timely and objective.

docs.title: CMS State Operations Manual Appendix PP (LTC Guidance)
docs.heading: Investigation & documentation
docs.text: Facilities should investigate incidents/accidents and document assessment, interventions, notifications, and follow-up actions. Ensure documentation is timely and objective.

docs.title: CDC Infection Control (Standard + Transmission-Based Precautions)
docs.heading: Standard Precautions
docs.text: Standard Precautions apply to all residents. Perform hand hygiene and use PPE based on anticipated exposure. Maintain infection control practices throughout.

docs.title: NYSDOH Infection Prevention / Communicable Disease Guidance (LTC)
docs.heading: Outbreak reporting
docs.text: Notify appropriate parties per NYSDOH guidance when outbreak thresholds are met; maintain line lists as required. Compare findings to baseline and note any change.

docs.title: Change of Condition / Provider Notification Policy
docs.heading: Documentation essentials
docs.url_or_location: Binder: Nursing Admin → Policies → Change of Condition
docs.text: Document objective assessment findings, interventions performed, resident response, provider notification, orders received, and family/EC notification when applicable. Compare findings to baseline and note any change.

docs.title: Infection Prevention Policy
docs.heading: Specimen & labs
docs.text: Collect specimens per order and protocol, label correctly, and document collection time and resident tolerance. Compare findings to baseline and note any change.

docs.title: Falls: Post-Fall Assessment & Monitoring
docs.heading: Neuro checks pathway
docs.text: Initiate neuro checks per protocol/orders when indicated (head strike suspected, anticoagulants, AMS, abnormal neuro findings). Ensure documentation is timely and objective.

docs.title: CMS State Operations Manual Appendix PP (LTC Guidance)
docs.heading: Reporting expectations
docs.text: Follow facility and regulatory reporting requirements for allegations, incidents, and significant changes. Compare findings to baseline and note any change.

docs.title: CDC Infection Control (Standard + Transmission-Based Precautions)
docs.heading: Transmission-Based Precautions
docs.text: Use Contact/Droplet/Airborne precautions when indicated. Post signage and ensure staff education. Use facility forms/logs as required.

docs.title: NYSDOH Infection Prevention / Communicable Disease Guidance (LTC)
docs.heading: Outbreak reporting
docs.text: Notify appropriate parties per NYSDOH guidance when outbreak thresholds are met; maintain line lists as required. Compare findings to baseline and note any change.

docs.title: Change of Condition / Provider Notification Policy
docs.heading: Documentation essentials
docs.url_or_location: Binder: Nursing Admin → Policies → Change of Condition
docs.text: Document objective assessment findings, interventions performed, resident response, provider notification, orders received, and family/EC notification when applicable. Maintain infection control practices throughout.

docs.title: Infection Prevention Policy
docs.heading: Infection control actions
docs.text: Implement appropriate precautions, ensure hand hygiene/PPE, and notify IP per facility process. Consider cohorting during outbreaks. Maintain infection control practices throughout.

docs.title: Falls: Post-Fall Assessment & Monitoring
docs.heading: Immediate post-fall assessment
docs.text: Assess for injury, pain, ROM, neuro status, head strike, bleeding/bruising, and compare to baseline. Obtain vital signs. Escalate for red flags per protocol/provider orders.

docs.title: CMS State Operations Manual Appendix PP (LTC Guidance)
docs.heading: Reporting expectations
docs.text: Follow facility and regulatory reporting requirements for allegations, incidents, and significant changes. Ensure documentation is timely and objective.

docs.title: CDC Infection Control (Standard + Transmission-Based Precautions)
docs.heading: Transmission-Based Precautions
docs.text: Use Contact/Droplet/Airborne precautions when indicated. Post signage and ensure staff education. Escalate for red flags per protocol/provider orders.

docs.title: NYSDOH Infection Prevention / Communicable Disease Guidance (LTC)
docs.heading: Outbreak reporting
docs.text: Notify appropriate parties per NYSDOH guidance when outbreak thresholds are met; maintain line lists as required. Ensure documentation is timely and objective.

docs.title: Change of Condition / Provider Notification Policy
docs.heading: Monitoring after change
docs.url_or_location: Binder: Nursing Admin → Policies → Change of Condition
docs.text: Increase monitoring frequency based on clinical presentation and provider orders; document trends and escalation criteria. Escalate for red flags per protocol/provider orders.

docs.title: Infection Prevention Policy
docs.heading: Specimen & labs
docs.text: Collect specimens per order and protocol, label correctly, and document collection time and resident tolerance. Escalate for red flags per protocol/provider orders.

docs.title: Falls: Post-Fall Assessment & Monitoring
docs.heading: Notifications & reporting
docs.text: Notify provider and family/EC per policy; complete incident report and update care plan/interventions. Ensure documentation is timely and objective.

docs.title: CMS State Operations Manual Appendix PP (LTC Guidance)
docs.heading: Investigation & documentation
docs.text: Facilities should investigate incidents/accidents and document assessment, interventions, notifications, and follow-up actions. Compare findings to baseline and note any change.

docs.title: CDC Infection Control (Standard + Transmission-Based Precautions)
docs.heading: Standard Precautions
docs.text: Standard Precautions apply to all residents. Perform hand hygiene and use PPE based on anticipated exposure. Use facility forms/logs as required.

docs.title: NYSDOH Infection Prevention / Communicable Disease Guidance (LTC)
docs.heading: Communicable disease control
docs.text: Implement isolation and monitoring consistent with guidance; document symptoms, onset, and interventions. Maintain infection control practices throughout.

docs.title: Change of Condition / Provider Notification Policy
docs.heading: Documentation essentials
docs.url_or_location: Binder: Nursing Admin → Policies → Change of Condition
docs.text: Document objective assessment findings, interventions performed, resident response, provider notification, orders received, and family/EC notification when applicable. Compare findings to baseline and note any change.

docs.title: Infection Prevention Policy
docs.heading: Fever evaluation
docs.text: Assess for onset, associated symptoms (respiratory/GU/GI/wound), vital signs, SpO2, hydration status, and mental status compared to baseline. Compare findings to baseline and note any change.

docs.title: Falls: Post-Fall Assessment & Monitoring
docs.heading: Neuro checks pathway
docs.text: Initiate neuro checks per protocol/orders when indicated (head strike suspected, anticoagulants, AMS, abnormal neuro findings). Escalate for red flags per protocol/provider orders.

docs.title: CMS State Operations Manual Appendix PP (LTC Guidance)
docs.heading: Reporting expectations
docs.text: Follow facility and regulatory reporting requirements for allegations, incidents, and significant changes. Maintain infection control practices throughout.

docs.title: CDC Infection Control (Standard + Transmission-Based Precautions)
docs.heading: Transmission-Based Precautions
docs.text: Use Contact/Droplet/Airborne precautions when indicated. Post signage and ensure staff education. Maintain infection control practices throughout.

docs.title: NYSDOH Infection Prevention / Communicable Disease Guidance (LTC)
docs.heading: Outbreak reporting
docs.text: Notify appropriate parties per NYSDOH guidance when outbreak thresholds are met; maintain line lists as required. Use facility forms/logs as required.

docs.title: Change of Condition / Provider Notification Policy
docs.heading: Provider notification (SBAR)
docs.url_or_location: Binder: Nursing Admin → Policies → Change of Condition
docs.text: Use SBAR to notify the provider of significant change in condition. Include baseline comparison, objective findings, and specific request. Compare findings to baseline and note any change.

docs.title: Infection Prevention Policy
docs.heading: Specimen & labs
docs.text: Collect specimens per order and protocol, label correctly, and document collection time and resident tolerance. Ensure documentation is timely and objective.

docs.title: Falls: Post-Fall Assessment & Monitoring
docs.heading: Notifications & reporting
docs.text: Notify provider and family/EC per policy; complete incident report and update care plan/interventions. Ensure documentation is timely and objective.

docs.title: CMS State Operations Manual Appendix PP (LTC Guidance)
docs.heading: Investigation & documentation
docs.text: Facilities should investigate incidents/accidents and document assessment, interventions, notifications, and follow-up actions. Maintain infection control practices throughout.

docs.title: CDC Infection Control (Standard + Transmission-Based Precautions)
docs.heading: Respiratory hygiene
docs.text: Encourage source control, cough etiquette, and masking during respiratory illness as indicated. Escalate for red flags per protocol/provider orders.

docs.title: NYSDOH Infection Prevention / Communicable Disease Guidance (LTC)
docs.heading: Communicable disease control
docs.text: Implement isolation and monitoring consistent with guidance; document symptoms, onset, and interventions. Use facility forms/logs as required.

docs.url_or_location: Binder: Nursing Admin → Policies → Change of Condition
docs.text: Use SBAR to notify the provider of significant change in condition. Include baseline comparison, objective findings, and specific request. Escalate for red flags per protocol/provider orders.

docs.heading: Specimen & labs

docs.heading: Notifications & reporting

docs.text: Standard Precautions apply to all residents. Perform hand hygiene and use PPE based on anticipated exposure. Maintain infection control practices throughout.

docs.title: NYSDOH Infection Prevention / Communicable Disease Guidance (LTC)
docs.heading: Staff guidance
docs.text: Reinforce PPE, hand hygiene, and exclusion guidance per facility/NYSDOH recommendations when applicable. Compare findings to baseline and note any change.

docs.heading: Care planning
docs.text: Identify and address risks through individualized interventions and care plan updates; document implementation. Escalate for red flags per protocol/provider orders.

docs.title: CDC Infection Control (Standard + Transmission-Based Precautions)
docs.heading: Transmission-Based Precautions
docs.text: Use Contact/Droplet/Airborne precautions when indicated. Post signage and ensure staff education. Escalate for red flags per protocol/provider orders.

docs.title: NYSDOH Infection Prevention / Communicable Disease Guidance (LTC)
docs.heading: Communicable disease control
docs.text: Implement isolation and monitoring consistent with guidance; document symptoms, onset, and interventions. Use facility forms/logs as required.

docs.title: Change of Condition / Provider Notification Policy
docs.heading: Documentation essentials
docs.url_or_location: Binder: Nursing Admin → Policies → Change of Condition
docs.text: Document objective assessment findings, interventions performed, resident response, provider notification, orders received, and family/EC notification when applicable. Escalate for red flags per protocol/provider orders.

docs.title: Infection Prevention Policy
docs.heading: Specimen & labs
docs.text: Collect specimens per order and protocol, label correctly, and document collection time and resident tolerance. Ensure documentation is timely and objective.

docs.title: Falls: Post-Fall Assessment & Monitoring
docs.heading: Neuro checks pathway
docs.text: Initiate neuro checks per protocol/orders when indicated (head strike suspected, anticoagulants, AMS, abnormal neuro findings). Ensure documentation is timely and objective.

docs.title: CMS State Operations Manual Appendix PP (LTC Guidance)
docs.heading: Investigation & documentation
docs.text: Facilities should investigate incidents/accidents and document assessment, interventions, notifications, and follow-up actions. Escalate for red flags per protocol/provider orders.

docs.title: CDC Infection Control (Standard + Transmission-Based Precautions)
docs.heading: Transmission-Based Precautions
docs.text: Use Contact/Droplet/Airborne precautions when indicated. Post signage and ensure staff education. Use facility forms/logs as required.

docs.title: NYSDOH Infection Prevention / Communicable Disease Guidance (LTC)
docs.heading: Staff guidance
docs.text: Reinforce PPE, hand hygiene, and exclusion guidance per facility/NYSDOH recommendations when applicable. Ensure documentation is timely and objective.

docs.title: Change of Condition / Provider Notification Policy
docs.heading: Provider notification (SBAR)
docs.url_or_location: Binder: Nursing Admin → Policies → Change of Condition
docs.text: Use SBAR to notify the provider of significant change in condition. Include baseline comparison, objective findings, and specific request. Escalate for red flags per protocol/provider orders.

docs.title: Infection Prevention Policy
docs.heading: Fever evaluation
docs.text: Assess for onset, associated symptoms (respiratory/GU/GI/wound), vital signs, SpO2, hydration status, and mental status compared to baseline. Use facility forms/logs as required.

docs.title: Falls: Post-Fall Assessment & Monitoring
docs.heading: Neuro checks pathway
docs.text: Initiate neuro checks per protocol/orders when indicated (head strike suspected, anticoagulants, AMS, abnormal neuro findings). Escalate for red flags per protocol/provider orders.

docs.title: CMS State Operations Manual Appendix PP (LTC Guidance)
docs.heading: Care planning
docs.text: Identify and address risks through individualized interventions and care plan updates; document implementation. Maintain infection control practices throughout.

docs.title: CDC Infection Control (Standard + Transmission-Based Precautions)
docs.heading: Respiratory hygiene
docs.text: Encourage source control, cough etiquette, and masking during respiratory illness as indicated. Compare findings to baseline and note any change.

docs.title: NYSDOH Infection Prevention / Communicable Disease Guidance (LTC)
docs.heading: Staff guidance
docs.text: Reinforce PPE, hand hygiene, and exclusion guidance per facility/NYSDOH recommendations when applicable. Compare findings to baseline and note any change.

docs.title: Change of Condition / Provider Notification Policy
docs.heading: Provider notification (SBAR)
docs.url_or_location: Binder: Nursing Admin → Policies → Change of Condition
docs.text: Use SBAR to notify the provider of significant change in condition. Include baseline comparison, objective findings, and specific request. Maintain infection control practices throughout.

docs.title: Infection Prevention Policy
docs.heading: Infection control actions
docs.text: Implement appropriate precautions, ensure hand hygiene/PPE, and notify IP per facility process. Consider cohorting during outbreaks. Maintain infection control practices throughout.

docs.title: Falls: Post-Fall Assessment & Monitoring
docs.heading: Neuro checks pathway
docs.text: Initiate neuro checks per protocol/orders when indicated (head strike suspected, anticoagulants, AMS, abnormal neuro findings). Maintain infection control practices throughout.

docs.title: CMS State Operations Manual Appendix PP (LTC Guidance)
docs.heading: Care planning
docs.text: Identify and address risks through individualized interventions and care plan updates; document implementation. Maintain infection control practices throughout.

docs.title: CDC Infection Control (Standard + Transmission-Based Precautions)
docs.heading: Standard Precautions
docs.text: Standard Precautions apply to all residents. Perform hand hygiene and use PPE based on anticipated exposure. Use facility forms/logs as required.

docs.title: NYSDOH Infection Prevention / Communicable Disease Guidance (LTC)
docs.heading: Staff guidance
docs.text: Reinforce PPE, hand hygiene, and exclusion guidance per facility/NYSDOH recommendations when applicable. Maintain infection control practices throughout.

docs.title: Change of Condition / Provider Notification Policy
docs.heading: Provider notification (SBAR)
docs.url_or_location: Binder: Nursing Admin → Policies → Change of Condition
docs.text: Use SBAR to notify the provider of significant change in condition. Include baseline comparison, objective findings, and specific request. Use facility forms/logs as required.

docs.title: Infection Prevention Policy
docs.heading: Infection control actions
docs.text: Implement appropriate precautions, ensure hand hygiene/PPE, and notify IP per facility process. Consider cohorting during outbreaks. Ensure documentation is timely and objective.

docs.title: Falls: Post-Fall Assessment & Monitoring
docs.heading: Notifications & reporting
docs.text: Notify provider and family/EC per policy; complete incident report and update care plan/interventions. Use facility forms/logs as required.

docs.title: CMS State Operations Manual Appendix PP (LTC Guidance)
docs.heading: Care planning
docs.text: Identify and address risks through individualized interventions and care plan updates; document implementation. Compare findings to baseline and note any change.

docs.title: CDC Infection Control (Standard + Transmission-Based Precautions)
docs.heading: Standard Precautions
docs.text: Standard Precautions apply to all residents. Perform hand hygiene and use PPE based on anticipated exposure. Maintain infection control practices throughout.

docs.title: NYSDOH Infection Prevention / Communicable Disease Guidance (LTC)
docs.heading: Staff guidance
docs.text: Reinforce PPE, hand hygiene, and exclusion guidance per facility/NYSDOH recommendations when applicable. Ensure documentation is timely and objective.

docs.title: Change of Condition / Provider Notification Policy
docs.heading: Provider notification (SBAR)
docs.url_or_location: Binder: Nursing Admin → Policies → Change of Condition
docs.text: Use SBAR to notify the provider of significant change in condition. Include baseline comparison, objective findings, and specific request. Escalate for red flags per protocol/provider orders.

docs.title: Infection Prevention Policy
docs.heading: Specimen & labs
docs.text: Collect specimens per order and protocol, label correctly, and document collection time and resident tolerance. Use facility forms/logs as required.

docs.title: Falls: Post-Fall Assessment & Monitoring
docs.heading: Notifications & reporting
docs.text: Notify provider and family/EC per policy; complete incident report and update care plan/interventions. Maintain infection control practices throughout.

docs.title: CMS State Operations Manual Appendix PP (LTC Guidance)
docs.heading: Reporting expectations
docs.text: Follow facility and regulatory reporting requirements for allegations, incidents, and significant changes. Ensure documentation is timely and objective.

docs.title: CDC Infection Control (Standard + Transmission-Based Precautions)
docs.heading: Transmission-Based Precautions
docs.text: Use Contact/Droplet/Airborne precautions when indicated. Post signage and ensure staff education. Escalate for red flags per protocol/provider orders.

docs.title: NYSDOH Infection Prevention / Communicable Disease Guidance (LTC)
docs.heading: Staff guidance
docs.text: Reinforce PPE, hand hygiene, and exclusion guidance per facility/NYSDOH recommendations when applicable. Compare findings to baseline and note any change.

docs.title: Change of Condition / Provider Notification Policy
docs.heading: Provider notification (SBAR)
docs.url_or_location: Binder: Nursing Admin → Policies → Change of Condition
docs.text: Use SBAR to notify the provider of significant change in condition. Include baseline comparison, objective findings, and specific request. Compare findings to baseline and note any change.

docs.title: Infection Prevention Policy
docs.heading: Fever evaluation
docs.text: Assess for onset, associated symptoms (respiratory/GU/GI/wound), vital signs, SpO2, hydration status, and mental status compared to baseline. Escalate for red flags per protocol/provider orders.

docs.title: Falls: Post-Fall Assessment & Monitoring
docs.heading: Immediate post-fall assessment
docs.text: Assess for injury, pain, ROM, neuro status, head strike, bleeding/bruising, and compare to baseline. Obtain vital signs. Use facility forms/logs as required.

docs.heading: Care planning

docs.heading: Investigation & documentation

docs.heading: Standard Precautions

docs.title: NYSDOH Infection Prevention / Communicable Disease Guidance (LTC)
docs.heading: Outbreak reporting
docs.text: Notify appropriate parties per NYSDOH guidance when outbreak thresholds are met; maintain line lists as required. Escalate for red flags per protocol/provider orders.
